title: How to Upload Videos to Steam on PC or Mac

steps.headline: Upload the video to YouTube.
steps.description: If you’re not sure how to do this, see Upload a Video to YouTube. The YouTube video must be set to Public and allow embedding.

steps.headline: Open Steam on your Mac or PC.
steps.description: If you’re using a Mac it’s in the Applications folder. If you have Windows it’ll be in the All Apps area of the Start menu.

steps.headline: Sign in to Steam.
steps.description: If you’re not already signed in, enter your login details and click LOGIN. If you’re using Steam Guard, enter your code into the blank provided, then click OK to continue. You can close the Steam News pop-up if it appears.

steps.headline: Click your Steam name.
steps.description: It’s in the bar at the top of Steam (to the right of “Community”). This opens your Account Activity page.

steps.headline: Click Videos.
steps.description: It’s in the right column, near the center.

steps.headline: Click Link YouTube account.
steps.description: It’s near the top-center part of the screen (to the left of “Manage Videos”).

steps.headline: Click Access your YouTube videos.
steps.description: It’s the green button at the center of the screen. This brings you to a Google login screen.

steps.headline: Enter your Google account email address and click NEXT.
steps.description: Be sure to use the account associated with your YouTube account.

steps.headline: Enter your Google password and click NEXT.
Select your account.
steps.description: If you have multiple accounts, you’ll be prompted to select one now. Choose the one with which you uploaded the video. You’ll be redirected to Steam, where you’ll see a list of your YouTube videos.

steps.headline: Select the video you want to share.
steps.description: Click the empty button to the left of the video’s preview to select it. You can select more than one video if you wish.

steps.headline: Associate the video with a game.
steps.description: Under “2. Associate the video(s) with a game,” select a game from the drop-down menu. If the game is unlisted, type its name into the “Other / Unlisted” box.

steps.headline: Click Add video.
steps.description: It’s the green button under “3. Add it to your profile.” This shares the video on Steam. To view your videos at any time, click the Videos tab at the top of Steam.

text: Upload the video to YouTube. If you’re not sure how to do this, see Upload a Video to YouTube. The YouTube video must be set to Public and allow embedding. Open Steam on your Mac or PC. If you’re using a Mac it’s in the Applications folder. If you have Windows it’ll be in the All Apps area of the Start menu. Sign in to Steam. If you’re not already signed in, enter your login details and click LOGIN. If you’re using Steam Guard, enter your code into the blank provided, then click OK to continue. You can close the Steam News pop-up if it appears. Click your Steam name. It’s in the bar at the top of Steam (to the right of “Community”). This opens your Account Activity page. Click Videos. It’s in the right column, near the center. Click Link YouTube account. It’s near the top-center part of the screen (to the left of “Manage Videos”). Click Access your YouTube videos. It’s the green button at the center of the screen. This brings you to a Google login screen. Enter your Google account email address and click NEXT. Be sure to use the account associated with your YouTube account. Enter your Google password and click NEXT.  Select your account. If you have multiple accounts, you’ll be prompted to select one now. Choose the one with which you uploaded the video. You’ll be redirected to Steam, where you’ll see a list of your YouTube videos. Select the video you want to share. Click the empty button to the left of the video’s preview to select it. You can select more than one video if you wish. Associate the video with a game. Under “2. Associate the video(s) with a game,” select a game from the drop-down menu. If the game is unlisted, type its name into the “Other / Unlisted” box. Click Add video. It’s the green button under “3. Add it to your profile.” This shares the video on Steam. To view your videos at any time, click the Videos tab at the top of Steam.
